Detailed Description

CMorphology Simple morphological methods, Last updated 8/24/1999.

This class is part of the Image Processing Library IPL98.

Version:
1.01
Author:
Ivar Balslev ivb@mip.sdu.dk and René Dencker Eriksen edr@mip.sdu.dk

Member Function Documentation

bool ipl::CMorphology::Dilate (  const CStdImage &    ImgMask,
CStdImage &    Img
) 
 

Performs an erosion using "ImgMask" as the mask where active positions are pixel values different from 0.

The central pixel (w/2,h/2) is the effektive origin of the erosion process.

Parameters:
ImgMask  The mask to performe erotion with.
Img  pointer to the source-target image. If the image is 8 b/p the resulting image contains 0 for background pixels and 255 for foreground pixels.
Returns :
False, if either ImgMask or Img is empty or if Img is not 1 or 8 b/p.
Version:
0.90
Author:
Implementation by Ivar Balslev (ivb@mip.sdu.dk)
See also:
DilateFast

bool ipl::CMorphology::DilateFast (  CStdImage &    Img,
unsigned short    q10,
unsigned short    q20,
unsigned short    q30
) 
 

Performes a dilatation using a 3x3 mask specificed by three numbers q10,q20,q30, whose binary representation specifies the mask.

Color index 0 is background, outside image, background is assumed. This function is very fast.

Parameters:
Img  Source-target image. Must be 1 b/p.
q10  Bitmask for the first row in mask (values from 0 to 7).
q20  Bitmask for the second row in mask (values from 0 to 7).
q30  Bitmask for the third row in mask (values from 0 to 7).
Returns :
False, if source/target image is empty or not 1 b/p.
Version:
0.90
Author:
Implementation by Ivar Balslev (ivb@mip.sdu.dk)
See also:
Dilate

Performs an erosion using "ImgMask" as the mask where active positions are pixel values different from 0.

The central pixel (w/2,h/2) is the effektive origin of the erosion process.

unsigned short    q10,
unsigned short    q20,

) 
 

Performes an erotion using a 3x3 mask specificed by three numbers q10,q20,q30, whose binary representation specifies the mask.

Color index 0 is background, outside image, background is assumed. This function is very fast.

Parameters:
Img  Source-target image. Must be 1 b/p.

q20  Bitmask for the second row in mask (values from 0 to 7).

int ipl::CMorphology::Skeletonizing (  CStdImage &    Img ) 
 

Transforms all black components in a binary image to a skeleton defined by the medial axis transform (MAT).

Algorithm implemented with the method explained in Gonzales and Woods page 535-538.

Returns :
Total number of iterations (1 iteration is when all 8 masks have been used) or -1 if the image is empty or not 1 b/p.
Version:
0.50
Author:
Implementation by René Dencker Eriksen (edr@mip.sdu.dk)
See also:
Thinning , SkeletonZhou

Definition at line 186 of file morphology.cpp.

References ipl::CText::AppendIPL(), ipl::CStdImage::GetTImagePtr(), ipl::CStdImage::m_History, TString::pChars, and ipl::CText::RemoveLastLine().

int ipl::CMorphology::SkeletonZhou (  CStdImage &    Img,
bool    PreserveCorners
) 
 

A skeleton somewhere between the results of Thinning() and Skeletonizing() is produced.

The resultning skeleton is more roboust to noise on edges, i.e. it produces less small unwanted branches arising from noise on edges. But the skeleton is closer to a real MAT compared to the Thinning() algorithm. The algorithm is explained in detail in the article "A novel single-pass thinning algorithm and an effective set of performance criteria" by C. Quek & G. S. Ng. R. W. Zhou. Pattern Recognition Letters, 16:1267-1275, 1995. The parameter PreserveCorners is an additional feature to the original algorithm. It prevents the algorithm from eroding corners and the result is then very close to a MAT.

Parameters:
Img  Both source and target image. Must be 1 b/p.
PreserveCorners  An additional feature to the algorithm preventing it from eroding corners. If set to false, the algorithm is exactly as the one described in the article. To get more information about this contact René Dencker at edr@mip.sdu.dk.
Returns :
Total number of iterations or -1 if the image is empty or not 1 b/p.
Version:
0.50
Author:
Implementation by René Dencker Eriksen (edr@mip.sdu.dk)
See also:
Thinning , Skeletonizing

Definition at line 216 of file morphology.cpp.

References ipl::CText::AppendIPL(), ipl::CStdImage::GetTImagePtr(), ipl::CStdImage::m_History, TString::pChars, and ipl::CText::RemoveLastLine().

int ipl::CMorphology::Thinning (  CStdImage &    Img ) 
 

Reduces all black components in a binary image to single pixel wide branches and preserves the following properties: 1) Does not remove end points, 2) does not break connectedness, and 3) does not cause excessive erosion of the region.

The algorithm is described in detail in Gonzales and Woods page 491-494. Note: A thinning algorithm is not the same as a medial axis transform (MAT).

Returns :
Total number of iterations (one iteration is when step 1 and 2 have been performed) or -1 if the image is empty or not 1 b/p.
Version:
0.50
Author:
Implementation by René Dencker Eriksen (edr@mip.sdu.dk)
See also:
Skeletonizing , SkeletonZhou
